greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of digits of n in Roman numeral representation.
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3999
Stephanus Gibbs, Roman Numeral and Date Conversion
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Roman Numerals
maple: A093783 := proc(n) local r: r:=convert(n, roman): return add(convert(r[j], arabic), j=1..length(r)): end: seq(A093783(n), n=1..68); # _Nathaniel Johnston_, May 18 2011
mathematica: Total[#2 FromRomanNumeral[#1] & @@@ Tally[Characters@ RomanNumeral@ #]] & /@ Range@ 68 (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 08 2015, Version 10.2 *)
program: a093783 n = q 0 $ a061493 n where
where  (x',d) = divMod x 10; d' = fromInteger d
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 17 2004
